content: in 1 single_crochet increase in next* around 18 4 5 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 18 6 *single_crochet in 1 single_crochet decrease* around 12 7 *single_crochet in 2 single_crochet decrease* around 9 stuff the hand firmly at this point 8 work even 9 9 **using pink 9 work even 10 work even 9 20 slip_stitch join and bind off leave a tail about 8 long so you can sew each arm to the body do not stuff the rest of the arm sew arms to body just below the neck where shoulders would be legs make 2 row instruction stitches 1 **using pink 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in 1 single_crochet increase in next* around 18 4 *single_crochet in 2 single_crochet increase in next* around 24 5 6 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 7 *single_crochet in 2 single_crochet decrease* around 18 8 *single_crochet in 1 single_crochet decrease* around 12 9 work even 12 28 slip_stitch join and bind off leave a tail about 8 long so you can 6 sew the legs to the body if you want the doll to sit down do not stuff the rest of the leg if the doll will stand up stuff the whole leg firmly so it will hold her up later on sew legs to body as shown in pictures below page 5 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com jessie s hat row instruction stitches 1 **using your pajama color and a thin fuzzy yarn 6 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in 1 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 18 4 *single_crochet in 2 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 24 5 *single_crochet in 3 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 30 6 *single_crochet in 4 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 36 7 *single_crochet in 5 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 42 8 *single_crochet in 6 single_crochet increase in next single_crochet* around 48 9 10 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 48 11 work even but decrease 1 stitch in the round 47 12 repeat row 11 46 13 repeat row 11 45 14 single_crochet in first 17 single_crochet chain 1 and double_crochet in next 10 single_crochet chain 1 and single_crochet in last 18 single_crochet 45 slip_stitch join and bind off weave in the tail page 6 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together here are all the pieces laying out together i always start by sewing the head and body together since both parts ended with the same number of stitches you should have no trouble getting them to fit perfectly page 7 of 10 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com then i sewed on the ears just below
